content.description: This is the awesome, sketch mantle that pulls the blankest, bald, bulbously section. On the NE side of the South Side Boulder.
content.location: Start at crux of Send Train, smear feet high using gastone/pinch for left hand. Now reach as high as you can to locate cutter edge over the top of rounded top out. Now crank the Mantle!!!

climbs.name: Señor Parié Traverse AKA Send Train.

content.description: This is the classic Melrose traverse. The crux of this climb is close to the ground, on the NE side of boulder, it is one move. The rest of the climb traverses higher, with the most enjoyable bit being around the SE side of traverse!
content.location: Start anywhere, climb left to right or right to left.

content.description: The start is a tricky crimp where you match hands at a near-sit (see photos). Reach up into the crack with your right hand, then stand up and reach for the crimp with your left (do not borrow from the V0 route to the left). Bring your right hand back down to press on the smooth boulder to get your right foot onto the starting hold. Step up and cross your left foot over. The rest of the top-out is just a walk-up.
content.protection: One crash pad below start should be enough.
content.location: South side of the boulder, closer to the West end. See photos to find the start hold. There's only one crimp to the left of where you'll be sitting to start.

content.description: This is the hardest line on the SSB. Climb technical compression side pulls, up pillaresque feature to a heartbreak or back break, rounded sloping mantle. A fall at the top out can result in a slab crashing, summersault down the ramp at climbers right!
content.location: North side of SSB. Just left of the descent crack.
